evidence.pdf_reference: Pairing CO 2 reduction with oxidative organic synthesis in one photoredox cycle opens a new avenue for cooperative utilization of excited electrons and holes towards efficient solar-to-chemical energy conversion.In this work, we demonstrate a facile cetyltrimethylammonium bromide (CTAB) surfactant functionalized ZnIn 2 S 4 (ZIS)-based dual-functional reaction system for efficient visible light-driven CO 2 -to-CO conversion pairing with selective oxidation of benzyl alcohol to value-added CAC coupled

to value-added CAC coupled products.Our research suggests that the markedly enhanced redox activities are mainly attributed to the unique structure of CTAB-ZIS featuring more crystalline and surface defects, which greatly promotes the interfacial charge carrier transfer, and in particular elevates CO 2 activation and electrons reducibility.It is anticipated that this work would inspire further establishment of efficient novel photocatalysts and cooperative reaction system coupling CO 2 reduction and

experiments indicate that the reaction is a photocatalytic process, since the removal of light irradiation or catalysts results in the absence of products detection (entry 3 and 4) 33.Once CO 2 was replaced with Argon (Ar), no detectable CO was observed, suggesting that the carboncontaining products from decomposition of possible carbon residues on photocatalysts are negligible (entry 5) 34.Moreover, the half-reaction of photocatalytic CO 2 reduction with sacrificial reagents (TEOA) instead of BA exhibits

and H 2 respectively during the photocatalytic process.At the same time, the VB maximum of CTAB-ZIS elevates about 0.68 eV as compared to ZIS, implying that the ability of as-generated holes for oxidation was reduced to some extent, which is however not directly consistent with the promoted BA conversion of CTAB-ZIS.This is might because that the rate-determining step of this dual-functional reaction is the reductive reaction for COH 2 evolution 45.The suppressed H 2 evolution of ZIS also can be reflected

mg ZIS or CTAB-ZIS powders were dispersed in a mixed solution of 5 mL CH 3 CN containing 5 mL BA and DMPO (0.080 M), which was used as a spin-trapping agent, by ultrasonic treatment.Then, the suspension was injected into a glass capillary and the glass capillary was placed in a sealed glass tube under CO 2 atmosphere.The sealed glass tube was placed in the microwave cavity of EPR spectrometer and was irradiated with Xe lamp (k 420 nm) during EPR measurements at room temperature.The photoluminescence

selectivity difference 50.As schematically shown in Fig. 4a, upon light irradiation, the catalysts are photoexcited to produce electron-hole pairs.The BA will be firstly oxidized to a-hydroxybenzyl radicals (C a radicals), and the C a radicals either can be further oxidized by holes to form BAD, or combine with another C a radical to produce HB, which can undergo an oxidative dehydrogenation to BZ 15,18.The generation of C a radicals during the reaction was revealed by the in-situ EPR spectroscopic studies
